responsibilities: Define and measure quantitative UX goals and metrics in collaboration with Designers, Qualitative Researchers, Data Scientists, Engineers, and Program Managers.
Develop code and statistical models to understand user experience.

Conduct empirical research using methods from computer science, quantitative social science, statistics, econometrics, and other fields to understand user behavior and extract meaningful patterns from large data sets.
Examine existing data and product designs to generate hypotheses and plans for high-impact research.
Prioritize and drive research to improve user experience.
Communicate findings to stakeholders in the company.
Make research findings convincing and actionable for both research experts and non-experts.
qualifications: Proficiency in programming languages used for data manipulation and computational statistics (e.g., Python, R, MATLAB, C++, Java, or Go).
Expertise in descriptive, inferential, and multivariate statistics, including t-test and ANOVA, and experimental design.
Ability to program computational and statistical algorithms for large data sets.
Excellent command of research questions within a given domain, and of technical tools for the analysis of data within that field.
Skills in behavioral research design, statistical methods, and general programming.
analysis:
The job responsibilities and skills listed focus on quantitative UX research, data analysis, and statistical modeling. The responsibilities include defining and measuring UX goals, developing statistical models, conducting empirical research, examining data to generate hypotheses, and communicating findings. The skills required include proficiency in programming languages for data manipulation and computational statistics, expertise in statistical methods, and the ability to program algorithms for large data sets.

There is no explicit mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus is primarily on quantitative research, statistical analysis, and data-driven insights to improve user experience. While these skills could potentially be applied in the context of GenAI or LLMs, there is no direct indication that this job specifically involves working with these technologies.
